intro: Cynoglossum pustulatum subsp. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved bellflower, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. This perennial plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in the understory of temperate forests.
